entry.title: Future of the bitcoin-dev mailing list
entry.summary: Google Groups has been critiqued for its unwieldy user interface which complicates the search process for users. This platform, having inherited Usenet's database, presents challenges in locating specific content of interest due to its design and navigation issues. Furthermore, the prevalence of spam within Google Groups exacerbates the moderation workload significantly. There is a pressing need to maintain discussions on a mail server as moving away could potentially disrupt the functionality of numerous email clients that individuals rely on. The transition from a traditional mail server to Google Groups is fraught with difficulties that hinder efficient communication and community engagement.
